what: Functions to calculate eGFR by different equations
title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation
text: kidney.epi contains set functions calculate eGFR different equations either single patient dataset. following eGFR equations supported: CKD-EPI 2021 creatinine-based: function egfr.ckdepi.cr.2021() alias egfr.ckdepi.cr() CKD-EPI 2021 cystatin-based: function egfr.ckdepi.cr_cys.2021() CKD-EPI 2009 creatinine-based: function egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009() European Kidney Function Consortium (EKFC) creatinine-based: function egfr.ekfc.cr() EKFC cystatin-based: function egfr.ekfc.cys() Full age spectrum (FAS) creatinine-based: function egfr.fas.cr() FAS cystatin-based: function egfr.fas.cys() FAS creatinine-cystatin-based: function egfr.fas.cr_cys() Revised Lund-Malmö creatinine-based: function egfr.lm.cr() MDRD: function egfr.mdrd4() Lund-Malmö: function egfr.lm.cr() Schwartz: function egfr.schwartz() Chronic Kidney Disease Children (CKiD) U25 creatinine-based equation egfr.ckid_u25.cr() CKiD U25 cystatin-based equation egfr.ckid_u25.cys() underway. Scientific-Tools.Org provides research consulting services policy makers, industry, scientists, patient organizations, citizens. package developed free time support. use functions kidney.epi package data analysis manuscript preparation, please cite package: “Bikbov B. kidney.epi: Kidney-Related Functions Clinical Epidemiological Research. Scientific-Tools.Org, https://Scientific-Tools.Org. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.kidney.epi”. previous_headings: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation > Examples
title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation
text: calculate single patient, use following syntax:
code: # call egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009 function, and directly set parameters values egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009(   creatinine = 1.4,     age = 60,     sex = "Male",    ethnicity = "White",    creatinine_units = "mg/dl",    label_afroamerican = c("Afroamerican"),    label_sex_male = c("Male"),    label_sex_female = c("Female") ) #> [1] 54.22  # Definitions of the labels for sex and race are optional if you use the same labels defined as default in the function. The following also works well: egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009(   creatinine = 1.4,     age = 60,     sex = "Male",    ethnicity = "White",    creatinine_units = "mg/dl" ) #> [1] 54.22  # If you measure creatinine in micromol/l, it is possible to omit also 'creatinine_units' since the default value is "micromol/l": egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009(   creatinine = 103, # creatinine is in micromol/l   age = 60,     sex = "Male",    ethnicity = "White" ) #> [1] 67.7

previous_headings: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation > Examples
what: Example for a cohort of patients
title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation
text: calculate eGFR cohort patients dataset, use following syntax:
code: # copy as an example the internal dataframe ckd.data from R package to your dataframe mydata <- ckd.data  # calculate eGFR by CKD-EPI equation mydata$ckdepi <- egfr.ckdepi.cr.2009(   creatinine = mydata$cr, age = mydata$age,   sex = mydata$sex, ethnicity = mydata$ethnicity,   creatinine_units = "micromol/L",   # customize all labels for those used in the data frame if necessary   label_afroamerican = c("Black"),   label_sex_male = c("Male"), label_sex_female = c("Female") )  #> Warning in service.check_plausibility.age(age, max_age): There is 1 patient with negative values for age.  This value was substituted to NA. #> Warning in service.check_plausibility.age(age, max_age): There is 1 patient with age >100 years.  This value was substituted to NA. #> There are 840 patients with age <18 years.  These values were substituted to NA.  # show descriptive stat for the calculated values # note that synthetic data set ckd.data contains input parameters for both adults and children, and since the CKD-EPI equation was developed and validated for adults only, the resulting eGFR values for children will be NA. Use children-specific eGFR equations when necessary. summary(mydata$ckdepi) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.    NA's  #>   17.78   35.44   45.19   51.80   59.85  179.11     841

what: Advantages of the kidney.epi package functions
title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculation
text: Data workflow reproducible based verified algorithms: kidney.epi package offers reproducible, open-source workflow built verified methods, reducing duplication enabling teams focus truly matters: data insights. Thus, every research group rewrite computational code scratch. Control input values: input values plausible (negative values age creatinine, age exceeding logical limits, etc) suitable given eGFR equation (applicable children adults) - omitted, thus output robust results. Possibility use different measurement units creatinine: need decode creatinine values data set. Just define ‘creatinine_units’ parameter whether data contain values micromol/L, mmol/L mg/dL - rest processed function. data frame label “Male” males, can skip definition already assumed function, define clarity label_sex_male = “Male”. Consider labels case-sensitive, thus attentive “Male” “male” similar definitions. data frame uses different labeling conventions, can easily adjust labels function parameters align data. example, data frame contains labels “F” females “M” males, indicate labeling parameters function label_sex_male = “M”, label_sex_female = “F”. functions support also multiple labels non-standard mixed data. ’re working data hasn’t fully standardized — category might different labels — function allows define multiple values valid labels category. example, male sex represented “male” “hombre” labels female sex “female” “mujer” labels, can define: label_sex_male = c(“male”, “hombre”), label_sex_female = c(“female”, “mujer”). male sex represented “male” 1, can define: label_sex_male = c(“male”, 1). male sex represented “male” “Male” (case-sensitive), can define: label_sex_male = c(“male”, “Male”). result, need modify original dataset — just adjust function parameters instead. saves time reduces data preprocessing efforts, well improve code readability.

what: Calculate KDPI and KDRI with ktx.kdpi.optn
title: Kidney transplantation
text: Function ktx.kdpi.optn calculates Kidney Donor Risk Index (KDRI) Kidney Donor Profile Index (KDPI) based algorithm US Organ Procurement Transplantation Network. case use function kidney.epi package preparation manuscript, please use following citation: “Bikbov B. R open source programming code calculation Kidney Donor Profile Index Kidney Donor Risk Index. Kidney Disease. 2018; 4:269–272 doi:10.1159/000492427”. can use ktx.kdpi.optn function either calculation KDPI KDRI single patient, dataset. calculate single patient, use following syntax: calculate multiple patients dataset, use following syntax: Take account labels used parameters function correspond labels used data frame. example labels positive history hypertension defined label_hypertension_positive = c (“Yes”, “YES”) means data frame either “Yes” “YES”. case use different labeling data frame, define appropriately. example, define positive history hypertension 1 negative history 0, change labeling parameters function label_hypertension_positive = c (1). Important notice NA (available values) careful labeling missing/unknown data history hypertension diabetes. donors unknown history hypertension data file standard R missing value NA, set parameter label_hypertension_unknown = “NA” (quotes!). donors unknown history hypertension data file defined “data”, set parameter label_hypertension_unknown = “data”. donors unknown history hypertension data file defined 999, set parameter label_hypertension_unknown = 999. Note default KDPI KDRI calculated latest available OPTN revision (default parameter mapping_values_year = “latest”). wish change reference year, set mapping_values_year equal year. see years OPTN revision available R package, use function ktx.kdpi.optn.show.years().
code: # call ktx.kdpi.optn function, and directly set parameters values ktx.kdpi.optn(age = 60,    height_cm = 168,    weight_kg = 93,    ethnicity = "White",    hypertension = "yes",    diabetes = "no",    causeofdeath = "roadinjury",    creatinine = 1.4,    hcv = "negative",    dcdstatus = "no",    creatinine_units = "mg/dl",    return_output_type = "KDRI_Rao") #> For the calculations of KDRI and KDPI the  2024  year is used for mapping values, KDRI scaling factor, as well as chances of hypertension and diabetes in case if they were unknown for donor. #> [1] 1.8 # copy internal dataframe ktx.data from the kidney.epiR package to your data frame mydata <- ktx.data  # calculate Kidney Donor Profile Index (KDPI) using the latest available OPTN mapping values mydata$kdpi <- ktx.kdpi.optn ( age = mydata$don.age,   height_cm = mydata$don.height, weight_kg = mydata$don.weight,   ethnicity = mydata$don.ethnicity, hypertension = mydata$don.hypertension,   diabetes = mydata$don.diabetes, causeofdeath = mydata$don.causeofdeath,   creatinine = mydata$don.creatinine, hcv = mydata$don.hcv,   dcdstatus = mydata$don.dcd, creatinine_units = "mg/dl",   # which param to return   return_output_type = "KDPI",   # customize all labels used in the dataframe   # label for Afroamerican ethnicity    label_afroamerican = c ("Afroamerican"),   # label for a positive history of hypertension   label_hypertension_positive = c ("Yes", "YES"),   # label for an unknown history of hypertension   label_hypertension_unknown = "N/A", # if missing values defined unknown history then use "NA" (with quotes!)   # label for a positive history of diabetes   label_diabetes_positive = c ("Yes", "YES"),   # label for an unknown history of diabetes   label_diabetes_unknown = "N/A", # if missing values defined unknown history then use "NA" (with quotes!)   # label for a cause of death due to cerebrovascular/stroke   label_causeofdeath = c ("cerebrovascular"),   # label for a positive hcv status   label_hcv_positive = c ("positive"),   # label for an unknown, not done, indeterminate, or pending hcv status   label_hcv_unknown = "NA", # if missing values defined unknown history then use "NA" (with quotes!)   # label for a donation after circulatory death status   label_dcdstatus = c ("Yes") )  #> For the calculations of KDRI and KDPI the  2024  year is used for mapping values, KDRI scaling factor, as well as chances of hypertension and diabetes in case if they were unknown for donor.  # show descriptive stat for the calculated values summary(mydata$kdpi) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>   37.00   93.25   95.50   89.10   97.00  100.00

what: Show years available in the OPTN mapping table with ktx.kdpi.optn.show.years
title: Kidney transplantation
text: Shows years available R package OPTN mapping table, KDRI scaling factor, etc. years defined mapping_values_year parameter ktx.kdpi.optn function.
code: ktx.kdpi.optn.show.years() #> The following years are presented in tables with OPTN mapping values, KDRI scaling factor, etc.  #>  [1] 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 #> You can use any of this years in the mapping_values_year parameter of the ktx.kdpi.optn function for mapping calculations of KDPI and KDRI.

title: Calculate KDRI and KDPI for deceased kidney donor — ktx.kdpi.optn
text: age Numeric vector. Age, years. height_cm Numeric vector. defined either height_cm measured cm, height_ft height_inch measured feet inches. parameter height_cm greater 0, function uses cm, otherwise - feet inches. height_ft see height_cm height_inch see height_cm weight_kg Numeric vector. defined either weight_kg measured kg, weight_lb measured pounds. parameter weight_kg greater 0, function uses kg, otherwise - pounds. weight_lb see weight_kg ethnicity Vector. Ethnicity, specify case African-American donors special coefficient regression equation. value variable refers parameter label_afroamerican. hypertension Vector. History hypertension, specify case hypertensive donors special coefficient regression equation. value variable refers parameters label_hypertension_positive label_hypertension_unknown. diabetes Vector. History diabetes, specify case donors diabetes special coefficient regression equation. value variable refers parameters label_diabetes_positive label_diabetes_unknown. causeofdeath Vector. Cause death, specify whether death due cerebrovascular disease, reasons. creatinine Numeric vector. Serum creatinine, expressed "micromol/L", "mmol/L" "mg/dL". Units measurement defined variable creatinine_units (defined explicitly user, default value "micromol/L"). hcv Vector. Hepatitis C virus status. value variable refers parameters label_hcv_positive label_hcv_unknown. dcdstatus Vector. Donation circulatory death status. Specify whether organ donor circulatory death . value variable refers parameter label_dcdstatus. creatinine_units Character string. Units serum creatinne expressed. one following: "micromol/L", "mmol/L" "mg/dL". return_output_type Character string. Specify calculated parameter return function: "KDRI_Rao" - Raw Kidney Donor Risk Index, "KDRI_median" - scaled median Kidney Donor Risk Index, "KDPI" - Kidney Donor Profile Index. mapping_values_year Numeric value character string.  Specify year take OPTN mapping table, well KDRI scaling factor chances hypertension diabetes case unknown donor. default value "latest", function takes latest available OPTN mapping table coefficients internal dataframes ktx.kdpi_mapping_table ktx.kdpi_coefficients_table. necessary, user define exact year (.e. mapping_values_year = 2015). list available years run following: ktx.kdpi.optn.show.years(). label_afroamerican List. Label(s) Afroamerican ethnicity. label_hypertension_positive List. Label(s) positive history hypertension. label_hypertension_unknown List. Label(s) donors unknown history hypertension. label_diabetes_positive List. Label(s) positive history diabetes. label_diabetes_unknown List. Label(s) donors unknown history diabetes. label_causeofdeath List. Label(s) cause death due cerebrovascular/stroke. label_hcv_positive List. Label(s) positive HCV status. label_hcv_unknown List. Label(s) unknown, done, indeterminate, pending HCV status. label_dcdstatus List. Label(s) donor circulatory death status.

title: Calculate KDRI and KDPI for deceased kidney donor — ktx.kdpi.optn
text: Calculate Kidney Donor Risk Index (KDRI) Kidney Donor Profile Index (KDPI) based algorithm US Organ Procurement Transplantation Network. Kidney Donor Profile Index (KDPI) numerical measure combines ten donor factors summarize single number quality deceased donor kidneys relative recovered kidneys. KDRI calculated deceased donor! reading: OPTN web-based calculator Guide calculating interpreting KDPI Latest data mapping table, scaling factor, etc Citation: Bikbov B. R open source programming code calculation Kidney Donor Profile Index Kidney Donor Risk Index. Kidney Diseases, 2018; 4:269–272. DOI: 10.1159/000492427

title: Calculate albuminuria categories — nephro.albuminuria_category
text: albuminuria Numeric vector. Urine albumin, expressed "mg/day" (24-hour urine collection), "mg/mmol" (UACR) "mg/g" (UACR). Units measurement defined variable albuminuria_units (defined explicitly user, default value "mg/g"). albuminuria_units Character string. Units urine albumin measured. one following: "mg/day", "mg/mmol" "mg/g". semiquantitative_values Character string. Defines whether semiquantitative values allowed data. "", semiquantitative values ('<30', '30-300', '>300') numeric values (29, 30, 35, etc) classified categories (NB! '30-300' '30-299' classified A2). "only_limits", limiting semiquantitative values ('<30', '>300') classified categories, middle semiquantitative values ('30-300') omitted; numeric values (29, 30, 35, etc) classified categories. "forbidden", numeric values classified categories.
